name: Dialga
flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: You may return all Energy cards attached to Dialga to your hand. If you do, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from the Defending Pokémon and shuffle that card into your opponent's deck.

name: Dusknoir
flavorText: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent has 4 or more Benched Pokémon, you may choose 1 of them and shuffle that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck. This power can't be used if Dusknoir if affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Put 5 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. Then, count the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken and put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Electivire
flavorText: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), if Elekid is anywhere under Electivire, you may move a Lightning Energy attached to your Pokémon to Electivire. This power can't be used if Electivire is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electivire. If you do, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

name: Empoleon
flavorText: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Infernape
flavorText: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Infernape.

name: Lucario
flavorText: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Luxray
flavorText: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Luxray from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent's Bench isn't full, choose 1 Basic Pokémon from your opponent's hand, and put it onto his or her Bench. Then, switch it with the Defending Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Move all Lightning Energy attached to Luxray to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Ignore this effect if you don't have any Benched Pokémon.)

name: Magnezone
flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
Ability1Text: If you have any Metal Energy attached to your Active Pokémon, the Retreat Cost for that Pokémon is 0.
Attack1Text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to Magnezone.

name: Manaphy
flavorText: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Switch Manaphy with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Mismagius
flavorText: Its cries sound like incantations. Those hearing it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.
Attack1Text: Count the number of your Pokémon that have any damage counters on them. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Palkia
flavorText: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If there is any Stadium card in play, discard it.
Attack2Text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard all Energy attached to Palkia and put the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

name: Rhyperior
flavorText: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Rhyperior from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. Rhyperior can't attack during your next turn.

name: Roserade
flavorText: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If Budew is anywhere under Roserade, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Shiftry
flavorText: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 ft/second that can level houses.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Shiftry is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Evolved Pokémon on your opponent's Bench, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokémon, and put it back into his or her hand. This power can't be used if Shiftry is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Skuntank
flavorText: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

name: Staraptor
flavorText: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all damage done to Staraptor by attacks (both yours and your opponent's) until the end of your next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Staraptor does 100 damage to itself.

name: Torterra
flavorText: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Remove 2 damage counters from each of your Grass Pokémon.

name: Azumarill
flavorText: It lives in rivers and lakes. In water, its coloring and patterns trick the vision of foes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Azumarill during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If Azumarill has 3 or more Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If Azurill is anywhere under Azumarill, flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Beautifly
flavorText: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: After your attack, remove from Beautifly the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Bibarel
flavorText: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
Attack1Text: Remove all Special Conditions and 4 damage counters from Bibarel. Bibarel is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Bibarel does 10 damage to itself.

name: Carnivine
flavorText: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Carnivine. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Carnivine's, this attack does 60 damage instead.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Clefable
flavorText: Rarely seen by people, it is said to be drawn by the full moon to play at deserted lakes.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) Clefable performs that attack.

name: Drapion
flavorText: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Drifblim
flavorText: It's drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for up to 5 in any combination of Pokémon and Supporter cards. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Dustox
flavorText: A nocturnal Pokémon. Drawn by streetlights, they messily eat the leaves of trees lining boulevards.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

name: Floatzel
flavorText: It floats using its well-developed floatation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Floatzel but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

name: Gengar
flavorText: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools that area by nearly 10 degrees F.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until it is 10 HP away from being Knocked Out.
Attack2Text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. Then, switch Gengar with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Heracross
flavorText: It gathers in forests to search for tree sap, its favorite food. It's strong enough to hurl foes.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Hippowdon
flavorText: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage.

name: Lopunny
flavorText: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. Remove a number of damage counters equal to the number of heads from 1 of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) You may switch Lopunny with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Machamp
flavorText: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.
Attack1Text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Medicham
flavorText: Through yoga training, it has honed its sixth sense. Its movements are elegant.
Attack1Text: Count the number of damage counters on Medicham. Put that many damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Medicham does 20 damage to itself.

name: Munchlax
flavorText: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Snorlax from your hand onto Munchlax (this counts as evolving Munchlax) and remove all damage counters from Munchlax.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, this attack does nothing.) Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Noctowl
flavorText: Its eyes are special. They can pick out objects as long as there is the tiniest amount of light.
Attack1Text: Choose a card from your hand and put it as a Prize card face up. Then, choose 1 of your face-down Prize cards without looking and put it into your hand. This attack does nothing if all of your Prize cards are face up.
Attack2Text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage.

name: Pachirisu
flavorText: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pachirisu does 10 damage to itself.

name: Purugly
flavorText: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon's nest and claims it as its own.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Snorlax
flavorText: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Snorlax is now Asleep. If Snorlax is evolved from Munchlax, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Steelix
flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Steelix can't attack during your next turn.

name: Vespiquen
flavorText: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by COMBEE.
Attack1Text: Discard a Grass Energy attached to Vespiquen and remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Grass Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage times the number of Grass Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Weavile
flavorText: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage times the total amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

name: Wobbuffet
flavorText: It desperately tries to keep its black tail hidden. It is said to be proof the tail hides a secret.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, move all damage counters from Wobbuffet to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Wynaut
flavorText: It grows strong by pushing up against others en masse. It loves eating sweet fruit.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Wobbuffet from your hand onto Wynaut (this counts as evolving Wynaut) and remove all damage counters from Wynaut.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

name: Budew
flavorText: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Roselia from your hand onto Budew (this counts as evolving Budew) and remove all damage counters from Budew.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Cascoon
flavorText: It is hot inside its cocoon. All the cells in its body create the energy for it to evolve.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if Cascoon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Cascoon if that damage is 30 or less.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Cherrim
flavorText: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage and remove 3 damage counters from Cherrim.

name: Drifloon
flavorText: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Dusclops
flavorText: Its body is hollow. It is said that those who look into its body are sucked into the void.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 2 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that doesn't have a Retreat Cost. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Elekid
flavorText: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can't store the energy it makes.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Grotle
flavorText: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Haunter
flavorText: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

name: Hippopotas
flavorText: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Luxio
flavorText: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Machoke
flavorText: MACHOKE's boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.
Attack1Text: Does 40 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

name: Magneton
flavorText: It is actually three MAGNEMITE linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it and switch that Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon.

name: Mantyke
flavorText: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mantine from your hand onto Mantyke (this counts as evolving Mantyke) and remove all damage counters from Mantyke.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Water Basic Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Monferno
flavorText: To intimidate attackers, it stretches the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to Monferno.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Nuzleaf
flavorText: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Prinplup
flavorText: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Rapidash
flavorText: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Rapidash and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Rhydon
flavorText: Its brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs. Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock.
Attack1Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.
Attack2Text: Rhydon does 10 damage to itself. Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

name: Riolu
flavorText: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Seaking
flavorText: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Seaking.

name: Silcoon
flavorText: It anchors itself by wrapping twigs with the silk from its body. It motionlessly awaits evolution.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, If Silcoon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Silcoon if that damage is 30 or less.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Staravia
flavorText: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon. It stays within a huge flock.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Unown [A]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown A is on your Bench, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

name: Unown [B]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown B is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, discard all cards attached to any 1 of your Unown and shuffle that Pokémon back into your deck.

name: Unown [C]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown C is on your Bench, you may flip coin. If heads, search your deck for any 1 Unown and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Unown [D]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown D is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, each player may draw a card. (You draw your card first.)

name: Azurill
flavorText: A Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Marill from your hand onto Azurill (this counts a evolving Azurill) and remove all damage counters from Azurill.
Attack1Text: Put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Bidoof
flavorText: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

name: Bonsly
flavorText: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body's fluid levels by eliminating excess.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Sudowoodo from your hand onto Bonsly (this counts as evolving Bonsly) and remove all damage counters from Bonsly.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn, and any damage done to Bonsly by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Buizel
flavorText: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.
Attack1Text: If Buizel has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Buneary
flavorText: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Chatot
flavorText: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Cherubi
flavorText: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If this attack does any damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove 1 damage counter from Cherubi.

name: Chimchar
flavorText: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Chimchar.

name: Clefairy
flavorText: Thought to live with others on quiet mountains, it is popular for its adorable nature.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If Clefairy is evolved from Cleffa, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Cleffa
flavorText: Its silhouette is like a star. It is believed to arrive riding on shooting stars.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Clefairy from your hand onto Cleffa (this counts as evolving Cleffa) and remove all damage counters from Cleffa.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Combee
flavorText: A Pokémon formed by three others. It busily carries sweet floral honey to VESPIQUEN.
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Duskull
flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Electabuzz
flavorText: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If Electabuzz is evolved from Elekid, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Gastly
flavorText: This Pokémon's body is 95% made up of gases, which are blown away by strong gusts of wind.
Attack1Text: Move 1 damage counter from Gastly to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Glameow
flavorText: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness if very popular among some.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Goldeen
flavorText: It swims elegantly by flittering its tail as if it were a dress. It has the look of a queen.
Attack2Text: Goldeen does 10 damage to itself.

name: Hoothoot
flavorText: It always stands on one foot. Even when attacked, it does not brace itself using both feet.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Machop
flavorText: It hefts a GRAVELER repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon is Confused, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Marill
flavorText: Using its tail as a float, it dives underwater. It likes eating plants that grow on river bottoms.
Attack1Text: If Marill is evolved from Azurill, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.
Attack2Text: Switch Marill with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Meditite
flavorText: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Meditite during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Mime Jr.
flavorText: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mr. Mime from your hand onto Mime Jr. (this counts as evolving Mime Jr.) and remove all damage counters from Mime Jr.
Attack1Text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

name: Misdreavus
flavorText: It loves to sneak up on people late at night, then startle them with its shrieklike cry.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Onix
flavorText: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph.
Attack1Text: Choose up to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Onix can't attack during your next turn.

name: Piplup
flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Ponyta
flavorText: About an hour after birth, its fiery mane and tail grow out, giving it an impressive appearance.

name: Rhyhorn
flavorText: Its body is clad in a thick hide, and its tackles topple buildings. Unfortunately, it is not smart.
Attack2Text: Rhyhorn does 10 damage to itself.

name: Roselia
flavorText: ROSELIA raised on clean drinking water are known to grow vividly colored flowers.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If Roselia is evolved from Budew, this attack does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Seedot
flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Seedot would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Seedot is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

name: Shinx
flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Skorupi
flavorText: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Sneasel
flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

name: Starly
flavorText: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Stunky
flavorText: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Turtwig
flavorText: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.

name: Wurmple
flavorText: It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a STARLY, it will defend itself with its spiked rear.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Empoleon LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose up to 2 cards from your opponent's hand without looking and put them face down next to the Defending Pokémon. (These cards are not in play or in your opponent's hand.) At the end of your opponent's next turn, return those cards to your opponent's hand. This power can't be used if Empoleon is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokémon (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Empoleon can't attack during your next turn.

name: Infernape LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Discard the other 2 cards. This power can't be used if Infernape is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for 8 Fire Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck. (This attack does nothing if you don't have 8 Fire Energy cards in your discard pile.)

name: Torterra LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Torterra is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Torterra does 30 damage to itself.
